intro: Psychotria pergamena, commonly known as the parchment psychotria, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its narrow, elongated leaves that resemble parchment, giving it its common name. It produces small, white or pale green flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Psychotria pergamena is often found in moist, shaded environments within tropical forests.
